title: Can AI be funny? Some comedians embrace AI tools but run own shows
description: Comedians like Jon Lajoie and King Willonius are embracing artificial intelligence tools to help them create humor. They just don't think AI is inherently funny.
content:
By MATT O’BRIEN, Associated Press Technology Writer
A baby and his family dog sit across from each other in a podcast studio.
“Welcome to the talking baby podcast,” says the infant, wearing headphones and sounding like a deep-voiced radio broadcaster... [6746 chars]

title: Lawyers to face regulators after AI was used to prepare legal document
description: Three lawyers will face Australian legal regulators, with one ordered to pay $10,000 in costs, after submitting a legal document prepared with artificial intelligence and found to contain "inaccurate and misleading references".
content:
Three lawyers have been referred to Australian legal regulators after artificial intelligence (AI) was used to prepare a court document with "erroneous citations".
A judgement handed down in Sydney last week by the Federal Circuit and Family Court of... [3091 chars]

title: DeSantis calls for strict oversight of AI in Florida
description: Gov. Ron DeSantis on Dec. 4 unveiled an extensive proposal to impose regulations on artificial intelligence and the data centers that power them.
content:
Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis has proposed an "AI Bill of Rights" to regulate artificial intelligence.
The proposal includes protections for children and consumers from chatbots and deepfakes.
DeSantis' plan puts him at odds with former President Donald ... [4385 chars]

title: Authors’ lawyers in $1.5 billion Anthropic settlement seek $300 million
description: Attorneys for authors and publishers in the $1.5 billion landmark copyright settlement with artificial intelligence company Anthropic have asked a federal judge in California to award them $300 million in legal fees.
content:
WASHINGTON, Dec 4 (Reuters) - Attorneys for authors and publishers in the $1.5 billion landmark copyright settlement with artificial intelligence company Anthropic have asked a federal judge in California to award them $300 million in legal fees.

title: Copper Mining Surges to Fuel AI Revolution

content: The rapid rise of artificial intelligence is driving an unexpected demand: copper. From electric vehicles to data centers, the metal’s conductivity makes it essential for powering the AI boom. Mining companies across the globe are racing to meet the ... [4164 chars]
